metadata.title: CVE-2016-8864 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
named in ISC BIND 9.x before 9.9.9-P4, 9.10.x before 9.10.4-P4, and 9.11.xbefore 9.11.0-P1 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(assertion failure and daemon exit) via a DNAME record in the answersection of a response to a recursive query, related to db.c and resolver.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8864` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.10').
